experience: You and Jeff both know JD Lasica, Dave Farber, and 49 others
Please nominate (tag) a friend to be invited to Fall 2017 MoNage - Oct 24-26 in Boston!
I am a fan of serendipity and synchronicity and increasing the frequency of serendipity and synchronicity in the lives of my friends.

I am grateful to the 120+ people from around the world who will be speaking at Fall MoNage. If someone close to you could benefit from hearing and connecting with people who have Big Ideas and are involved in: Messaging Platforms, Chatbots, Communications, Blockchain, Tokens & ICOs, AI, and Conversational Interfaces, please tag them to be considered for a scholarship for a conference pass. Hotel / Transportation is not included.
Have a startup/business idea? Bring it to #MoNage2017's "MoNage Fast Pitch" contest! You could win $5000 in $ETH!

Just a few days until the Fall 2017 MoNage! Blockchain, AI, Internet communications, chatbots, and more with the best in their fields! Come to the Boston Public Library, October 24th-26th! Register at https://MoNage.io!

Back in 1996, our first gathering about Voice and Video on the Internet helped seed the Internet Communications revolution. Looking back, many of the people who attended that first summit became the movers and the shakers behind more than 200 startups. In 1997 our gathering morphed into VON / Voice on the Net and thru 2008 these conferences became the meeting place where the future of communications evolved and where VoIP became the standard of the global telecommunications industry. Our conversations explored the state of the technology, the gaps in the markets of the then current products and public policy as we looked into the future. From the opportunity presented, we collectively raised billions of dollars and many delegates became competitors, players and positive disruptors in the telecommunications space. What resulted was the largest boom of innovation in communications in the past 50 years. During the days of VON over 120 of our exhibitors were acquired by 7 of our other exhibitors. Quite a number of startups went public and at times we hosted delegations from 40 to 65 different countries at the US events. MoNage: Messaging is the New Voice is a new event series started to bring together the leading thinkers, end users, and companies in the Internet Communications, Blockchain, Computing, and AI Industries and. The power, and potential, of Messaging in all its forms, is what MoNage is all about. Our goal is to build a community of people and companies to help grow the technology, usage, and business of Messaging. Messaging is a big and exciting field, with many areas of interest, including Chatbots, Enterprise-level messaging systems, blockchain messaging, security and encryption, interoperability among messaging platforms, new and exiting user conversational interfaces (think Amazon Alexa and other voice interfaces), and rich content capability.  Fall 2017 MoNage will be taking place October 24-26 in Boston. More information a http://monage.io

summary: Internet Pioneer, VoIP; Entrepreneur, Investor, Strategist, Photographer, Speaker, Futurist. Helped shape the worldwide market acceptance of VoIP; Founder / co-founder of numerous startups including Free World Dialup, VON, Vivox, MoNage and Vonage. Veteran of the Tradeshow industry; producer, host, curator of events.Known as a globally renowned Internet thought leader. In 1995 defined "VON" to stand for Voice/Video on the Net. From 1997 to 2008 he hosted/produced the VON Conferences. In 2009 started the #140conf events. Founded MoNage in 2016. His work in Washington is the reason services like: FaceTime, Messenger and WhatsApp are free. Has influenced the creation of numerous other startups. Currently exploring the intersection of: Computing, AI and Communications. Strategic advisor to a number of Block chain projects.Has invested in over 350 startups since 1998.In 2012 Jeff adopted a lifestyle of health and wellness and dropped 120 pounds (54 kilos) along the way. Advocate of healthy living.Mr. Pulver is committed to the future of the Internet and is featured often in the media as an expert in his field.-- Proud Achievement: The Pulver Order --On February 12, 2004, Mr. Pulver's petition for clarification declaring Free World Dialup as an unregulated information service was granted by the Federal Communications Commission (FCC). This landmark decision was the first decision it made on IP communications. Now referred to as "the Pulver Order", the ruling provides important clarification that computer-to-computer VoIP service is not a telecommunications service. By doing this, the FCC delivered a strong signal to consumers and capital markets that the FCC is not interested in subjecting end-to-end IP Communications services to traditional voice telecommunications regulation under the Communications Act.
name: Jeff Pulver
title: helped make VoIP happen. Continuing to explore Disruptive Technologies
